job_title: Medical Assistant in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: Lots of good coworkers, benefits.
cons: Supervisor rude. They pay the new hires a lot more money. Ask for extra work but will not show gratitude. Upper management over works you and does not stick to their word.

job_title: LVN in Mission Hills, CA
pros: Coworkers make the environment tolerable and the benefits are good.
cons: Literally everything else! The supervisors are a hot mess! They lie for each other. You get write ups from different supervisors. Supervisors skip the normal discipline write up procedures and jump straight to final warnings which will leave you without a raise or promotion for a year and even after that it WILL be held against you. And some supervisors have no clue what they’re doing! And if you think the administration has power, then think again because she’s easily influenced by the supervisors so there’s no actual boss there! It’s a trash clinic in terms of administration.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Valencia, CA

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Mission Hills, CA

job_title: LVN in Mission Hills, CA

job_title: Medical Assistant II in Valencia, CA
pros: friendly staff and great benefits
cons: Micromanaging, core leader,literally everyone dislikes her, she treats and talks to you like a child, she will answer your question with a question. Core leader has no problem solving skills unless the answer is to get rid of you.

review_title: It's Better than working for the DMV, but not as cool as working for Big Pharma
job_title: in Mission Hills, CA
pros: There's always food around. The atmosphere is business-like but not terribly strict. Sure, there are policies and procedures and the like, but the employees tend to treat each other like buddies.
cons: Not everyone is your buddy, and many of those folks are in positions of power. There's a real dependency on committee-based decision-making here that really feels like a waste of everyone's time. On the bright side, many people get involved in shaping the direction of the company. The drawback is that many people get involved in shaping the direction of the company.

review_title: Under-Educated Middle Management-They Get What They Pay For
job_title: Medical Assistant in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: Convenient suburban locations and good benefits.
cons: Middle management consists of Facey "lifers" who managed to get promoted because they were never willing or able to find better employment - this is most evident when reading email communications with grammatical errors that might embarrass a 12 year-old. There is an air of frustration resulting from a lack of two-way communication. Upper management doesn't listen to middle management, and middle management passes that frustration along to their employees. This ultimately creates a largely indifferent staff interacting with patients, which is evident in the overall quality of care.

review_title: a happy employee will work more efficiently and to theextra mine for a company that cares
job_title: Medical Receptionist in San Gabriel, CA
pros: Positive atmosphere,  every morning manager would go to every department and greet all employees making sure everything was running appropriately and that there was coverage for any personal needed.  They also planned activities for the employees it was a very fun caring enviroment for both employees and patients.
cons: The san Gabriel location was farther away from all the other locations so it was hard to refer patients to other locations to offer more availability

job_title: Assistant in Mission Hills, CA
pros: Grateful to have a paycheck, the stability is there for the most part but you'll have to be a very content person not wanting much improvement to stay with this company.
cons: Many depts. lack the ability to grow within the company. I know too many people there working over 20 years in the same position, capped salary and that's it for them. Not enough appreciation for their employee's it seems every year they take away more and more benefits.

job_title: Physician in Mission Hills, CA
pros: Great staff, diverse patient population, opportunity for research. Well organized EHR and ability to connect with outside resources for patients. Best for new physician experience.
cons: Wages below national standard, clickish factions within physician group, lots of back stabbing between physicians. Unable to express or share opinions without concern for political backlash. Many physicians leaving who can't or won't fit into the mold; seasoned physicians aren't made to feel welcome.

job_title: Administrative Receptionist in Mission Hills, CA
pros: They were very flexible with my full-time school schedule and I was able to work around my daytime classes and finish college. Everyone was helpful and it was a good work environment. Even though I was only a receptionist in an executive office, I still felt valuable to the staff. There were plenty of opportunities to grow in the company.
cons: There were a lot of changes happening to the company during and after I had to leave.

review_title: Very calm job although it does have its busy moments.
job_title: Lab Assistant in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: Very friendly co workers and patients. Hours of operation are reasonable but everyone seems to want the earlier shifts. Very clean facility.
cons: Some patients are very ill and sometimes one does not know what they have until after they are drawn. If you have no peds experience this is not the place for you, there are many children that get drawn at this site.

job_title: LVN in Mission Hills, CA
